title: Camera Calibration & Instrumentation Engineer
summary: Apple crafts consumer electronics that have touched millions and changed the way people harmonize with electronic devices around the world. The Technology Calibration & Test Group plays a key role in keeping up the standards, and through work with the team, you’ll have the outstanding opportunity to impact products all across Apple.
description: As camera calibration & instrumentation engineer, you will work with system and design counterparts to: - Define the end-to-end error budget to deliver critical features and user experience, including the capability and uncertainty of each individual HW component. - Specify calibration and test requirements of camera/depth/IMU components on new Apple products.
key_qualifications: Knowledge in imaging optics and camera modeling, Capability of developing image processing or computer vision algorithms, Matlab or C++, Data analysis and simulation, Matlab or Python, Experience with camera, depth or IMU components, Experience with robot control, Excellent written and verbal communication skills, willing to collaborate in a multi-functional environment, Strong problem-solving skills
education_experience: BS, MS in Engineering or related discipline
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. The base pay range for this role is between $136,300 and $248,700. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs.
